title: Portrait of Michael Young, brother of Solomon Young
Scopenote: Portrait of Michael Young, brother of Solomon Young.  On the back of original photo it says "My father, Michael Young, born April 4th A. D. 1800.  Died January 4th AD1876.  Age 75 years and 8 months.  From:  Copied from photos lent to the Truman Library by Martha Ann Swoyer, a daughter of Vivian Truman.

title: Portrait of Charles S. Young
Scopenote: Portrait of Charles S. Young, probably a distant relative of Harry Truman's on the Young side of the family.  The exact relationship is unknown.  On the back of original photo is says "Charles S. Young, son of W. K. and S. Young."  From:  Copied from photos lent to the Truman Library by Martha Ann Swoyer, a daughter of Vivian Truman.  Original photograph is by L. Bergman, Photographer, Nos. 56 & 58 W. Market St., bet. 2nd & 3d, Louisville, Kentucky.

title: Susan Young, Harry S. Truman's aunt
Scopenote: Portrait of Susan Young, daughter of Solomon Young and sister of Martha Ellen Truman.  Back of original photo says "Susan Young, my stepmother."  From:  Copied from photos lent to the Truman Library by Martha Ann Swoyer, a daughter of Vivian Truman.

title: Portrait of Elizabeth Boulware
Scopenote: Portrait of Elizabeth Boulware.  On back of original photo it says "Elizabeth Boulware, Uncle and Aunt of my wife, Jane Boulware."  From:  Copied from photos lent to the Truman Library by Martha Ann Swoyer, daughter of Vivian Truman.

title: Group of Truman relatives standing in front of an unidentified frame house
Scopenote: Group of people standing in front of an unidentified frame house. The couple in the back row, far right, are unidentified. First row, L to R: Martha Ellen Truman (as an older lady), Grace Summer (cousin of Harry Truman and sister for Ralph Truman), and Martha Ann Truman (Vivian Truman's daughter, later Martha Ann Swoyer), and the unidentified couple. From: Copied from photos lent to the Truman Library by Martha Ann Swoyer, daughter of Vivian Truman.

title: Rear of Truman Home in Snow
Scopenote: Rear of the Truman home showing steps leading down from the back porch and the arbor in the backyard.  The house is in snow, taken some time before 1954.  The photo is from original slide 2119.  From:  Truman house.

title: Two unidentified young women swimming in a creek
Scopenote: Two unidentified young women swimming in a creek or river.  The lady on the left looks like the same lady in photo 84-14-17.  Possibly taken near the Grandview farm.  From:  Copied from photos lent to the Truman Library by Martha Ann Swoyer, daughter of Vivian Truman.

title: Photo of Maud Gates Wells and Strother Wells
Scopenote: Photo of large, old Victorian house, with a picket fence around it.  In the yard stand, Left to Right: Maud Gates Wells, Madge Gates Wallace, and Maud's husband, Strother Wells.  Maud Gates Wells is the sister of Madge Gates Wallace.  From:  Copied from photos lent to the Truman Library by Martha Ann Swoyer, a daughter of Vivian Truman.

title: The rose arbor on the Grandview farm
Scopenote: Photograph of the rose arbor on the Grandview farm, where Harry S. Truman lived as a young man. This arbor is by a gate and looks out over a field. From: Lent to the Truman Library for copying by Mr. Dennis Flanery, of the Grandview Farm Foundation. Mr. Flanery received these photos from Ms. Dottie Hicks.

title: Grandview Farmhouse
Scopenote: Old photo of the Grandview farmhouse, a distance view of the house from the front. The rose arbor is visible as well as several of the large trees leading up to the house. The fence and farm buildings to the left of the house are also visible. The original photograph is owned by J. C. Truman, who lent it to the Library for copying in May, 1983.

title: Martha Ellen Truman as a young woman, with others
Scopenote: Portrait of Martha Ellen Truman as a young woman, with three others.  Martha Ellen Truman (President Truman\'s mother), or Matt Young, is left, standing.  Others in the photo are Ada Young and William A. Young, her sister and brother, and Maggie Conly.  Ada Young is probably standing to the left of Martha Truman, as there is a strong resemblance.  From:  Copied from photos lent to the Truman Library by Martha Ann Swoyer, daughter of Vivian Truman.  Original photo was by Babbitt & Shannon, 518 Main Street and 921 Junction, Main & Delaware, Kansas City, Mo.

title: Portrait of unidentified young girl
Scopenote: Portrait of unidentified young girl, probably taken in the 1800's.  Original photo was by W. Hare & Co., Independence, Missouri.  She is probably a relative of Harry Truman.  From:  Copied from photos lent to the Truman Library by Martha Ann Swoyer, a daughter of Vivian Truman.

title: Rose arbor on the Grandview farm
Scopenote: Photograph of the rose arbor on the Grandview farm. This arbor is by a gate and looks out over a field.  Lent to the Truman Library to be copied by Mr. Dennis Flanery, of the Grandview Farm Foundation. Mr. Flanery received these photos from Ms. Dottie Hicks.

title: Formal portrait of William and Laura Everhart
Scopenote: Formal portrait of William and Laura Everhart.  Laura Everhart is the sister of Martha Ellen Truman, mother of Harry S. Truman.  From:  Copied from photos lent to the Truman Library by Martha Ann Swoyer, daughter of Vivian Truman.  Original photo was taken in Springfield, Ill., S. P. Tresize, artist.

title: Portrait of Harriet Louisa Gregg Young
Scopenote: Very nice portrait of Harriet Louisa Gregg Young, grandmother of Harry S. Truman. Same as, but much better that, 78-92 and 62-348-1.  From:  Copied from photos lent to the Truman Library by Martha Ann Swoyer, daughter of Vivian Truman.

title: Portrait of K. L. Gregg
Scopenote: Portrait of K. L. Gregg, a young woman.  Probably ancestor of Harry Truman on the Gregg side of the family (Harriet Louise Gregg Young's family), however the exact relationship is unknown.  From:  Copied from photos lent to the Truman Library by Martha Ann Swoyer, daughter of Vivian Truman.

title: Portrait of Martha and Archibald Boulware
Scopenote: Portrait of Martha and Archibald Boulware.  On back of original photo it says "My ? Father & Mother-in-law, Archibald & Martha Boulware."  They are evidently relatives of the Truman's.  From:  Copied from photos lent to the Truman Library by Martha Ann Swoyer, a daughter of Vivian Truman.

title: Photograph of a Negro family outside of a house
Scopenote: Photograph of a Negro family outside of a house. Martha Ann Swoyer identified them as a family who helped the Trumans in the 1890's.  Copied from photographs loaned to the Harry S. Truman Library by Martha Ann Swoyer, daughter of J. Vivian Truman.

title: Portrait of Harry Truman's grandmother, Harriet Louisa Gregg Young
Scopenote: Portrait, somewhat faded, of Harry Truman's grandmother, Harriet Louisa Gregg Young, as an older woman.  From:  Copied from photos lent to the Truman Library by Martha Ann Swoyer, daughter of Vivian Truman.

title: John Anderson Truman Family Home, Independence, Missouri
Scopenote: Photograph of the home at 909 Waldo Avenue in Independence, Missouri, where Harry S. Truman lived in his youth.  Mary Jane Truman, as a child, and her grandmother, Harriet Young, are seated on the porch.    Copied from photographs lent to the Harry S. Truman Library by Martha Ann Swoyer, daughter of Vivian Truman.

title: Bess Wallace Truman ice-skating
Scopenote: Slightly blurred photo of Bess Wallace Truman ice-skating on a frozen pond.  There is an unidentified lady to her left.

title: Mary Jane Truman (left), and possibly Mary Ethel Noland and Robert Truman Ragland on Grandview farm
Scopenote: Mary Jane Truman is at left, a hammock is to her left; the others are possibly Mary Ethel Noland, and Robert Truman Ragland, "Trumie," who was the brother of Ardis Haukenberry and the son of Ruth Noland. They are on the Grandview farm.  From:  Copied from photos lent to the Truman Library by Martha Ann Swoyer, a daughter of Vivian Truman.

title: Distance view of the Grandview farmhouse
Scopenote: Very nice distance view of the Grandview farmhouse.  It is a winter scene, and a few of the Maple trees are in the foreground.    From:  Copied from photos lent to the Truman Library by Martha Ann Swoyer, a daughter of Vivian Truman.

title: Portrait of Grace Summer and family
Scopenote: Portrait of a man and woman and five children. Grace Summer, left, is a cousin of Harry Truman and sister of Ralph Truman.  On the back of the original photo it says "Harry S. Truman from  Cousin Grace Summer, Sept 17th, 1901."  Grace Summer roomed with the Truman family in Lamar.  From:  Copied from photos lent to the Truman Library by Martha Ann Swoyer, a daughter of Vivian Truman.

title: Man and woman plowing a field on the Grandview farm
Scopenote: A man and a woman plowing a field on the Grandview farm.  It is too far to identify either.    From:  Copied from photos lent to the Truman Library by Martha Ann Swoyer, a daughter of Vivian Truman.

title: Mary Jane Truman by the barn
Scopenote: Mary Jane Truman by the barn on the Grandview farm, holding two buckets and dressed in work clothes.  A small dog is with her.  From:  Copied from photos lent to the Truman Library by Martha Ann Swoyer, a daughter of Vivian Truman.

title: Martha Ellen Truman and Mary Jane Truman on farm
Scopenote: Martha Ellen Truman (left) and Mary Jane Truman in back of the Grandview farmhouse with two dogs.  One of the dogs is a greyhound.    From:  Copied from photos lent to the Truman Library by Martha Ann Swoyer, a daughter of Vivian Truman.

title: Harriet Young as an elderly woman
Scopenote: Harriet Young as an elderly woman, seated in a chair, smoking a corn-cobbed pipe.  She is in the doorway of what appears to be the Grandview farmhouse.  She is Harry S. Truman's maternal grandmother.  From:  Copied from photos lent to the Truman Library by Martha Ann Swoyer, daughter of Vivian Truman.

title: Martha Ellen Truman on Grandview farm
Scopenote: Martha Ellen Truman, mother of Harry Truman, at the pump in back of the Grandview farmhouse.    From:  Copied from photos lent to the Truman Library by Martha Ann Swoyer, a daughter of Vivian Truman.

title: Group of people sitting on a stack of logs at Grandview farm
Scopenote: Group of people sitting on a stack of logs at the Grandview farm.  The barn is in the background.  Possibly Harry S. Truman at the extreme left, and Mary Jane Truman is seated in the middle.  The rest are unidentified.    From:  Copied from photos lent to the Truman Library by Martha Ann Swoyer, a daughter of Vivian Truman.

title: Truman calling cards
Scopenote: Photos of calling cards belonging to Harry S. Truman, ca. 1904-05. One says "Harry S. Truman, Kansas City, Mo., 1314 Troost Ave." and the other says "Harry S. Truman." From: Calling cards, which were lent to the Truman Library by Martha Ann Swoyer, daughter of Vivian Truman.

title: A herd of sheep in a corral at the Truman farm in Grandview
Scopenote: A herd of sheep in a corral at the Truman farm in Grandview, Missouri.    From:  Copied from photos lent to the Truman Library by Martha Ann Swoyer, a daughter of Vivian Truman.

title: A herd of sheep in front of the Truman farmhouse
Scopenote: A herd of sheep grazing in front of the Truman farmhouse.    From:  Copied from photos lent to the Truman Library by Martha Ann Swoyer, a daughter of Vivian Truman.

title: Symbols of Masonry, Oil Painting by O. Cukor
Scopenote: Photograph taken from the original oil painting by O. Cukor, presented to the Harry S. Truman Library by the Eighth Masonic District Association of Manhattan to Grand Lodge, New York, N. Y. From: Grand Lodge Library and Museum, 74 W. 23rd St., N.Y., N.Y.

title: A dog and her puppies on the Grandview farm
Scopenote: A dog and her puppies on a blanket by a snowy field at the Truman farm in Grandview, Missouri.   From:  Copied from photos lent to the Truman Library by Martha Ann Swoyer, a daughter of Vivian Truman.

title: Mary Jane Truman in a horse-drawn buggy
Scopenote: One of a series of photos from Mary Jane Truman's Christmas Album, 1906.  Mary Jane Truman (driving) and two unidentified ladies in a horse-drawn buggy at the Grandview farm.  Caption says "Homeward Bound."   From:  Copied from photos lent to the Truman Library by Martha Ann Swoyer, daughter of Vivian Truman.

title: Snapshot of people rowing a canoe
Scopenote: One of a series of photos from Mary Jane Truman's Christmas Album, 1906.  Blurred snapshot of four people, possibly Mary Jane Truman being one of the women, rowing in a canoe near the Grandview farm.    From:  Copied from photos lent to the Truman Library by Martha Ann Swoyer, a daughter of Vivian Truman.

title: Mary Jane Truman and woman seated in woods
Scopenote: One of a series of photos from Mary Jane Truman's Christmas Album, 1906.  Mary Jane Truman (left) and unidentified woman seated in woods near the Grandview farm.    From:  Copied from photos lent to the Truman Library by Martha Ann Swoyer, a daughter of Vivian Truman.

title: View of the barn on the Truman farm
Scopenote: Good view of the barn on the Truman farm, with an old hay wagon and horses in front of it.  Caption says "The Barn that Grandpa Built."  One of a series of photos from Mary Jane Truman's Christmas Album, 1906.  From:  Copied from photos lent to the Truman Library by Martha Ann Swoyer, daughter of Vivian Truman.

title: Mary Jane Truman at the well on the Truman Farm
Scopenote: One of a series of photos from Mary Jane Truman's Christmas Album, 1906.  Mary Jane Truman(right) and two unidentified women at the well on the Truman Farm.  Caption says "A Cup of Cold Water."  From:  Copied from photos lent to the Truman Library by Martha Ann Swoyer, daughter of Vivian Truman.

title: Mary Jane Truman, Harriet Young, and Harrison Young on the Grandview farm
Scopenote: Left to Right:  Mary Jane Truman; Harriet Young, her great grandmother; and Uncle Harrison Young on the Grandview farm, by a corral.  Caption says "Grandma, Uncle Harrison, and Lovey Mary." One of a series of photos from Mary Jane Truman's Christmas Album, 1906.    From:  Copied from photos lent to the Truman Library by Martha Ann Swoyer, daughter of Vivian Truman.

title: Myra Colgan Hornbuckle standing at the well of the Truman farm
Scopenote: One of a series of photos from Mary Jane Truman's Christmas Album, 1906.  A lady is standing at the well on the Truman farm, with a suitcase in front of her.  Probably Myra Colgan Hornbuckle, a first cousin of Harry Truman.    From:  Copied from photos lent to the Truman Library by Martha Ann Swoyer, a daughter of Vivian Truman.

title: Mary Jane Truman standing in an asparagus patch
Scopenote: One of a series of photos from Mary Jane Truman's Christmas Album, 1906.  Mary Jane Truman (far left) and several unidentified women standing in an asparagus patch at the Grandview farm. Caption says "In the Asparagus."    From:  Copied from photos lent to the Truman Library by Martha Ann Swoyer, daughter of Vivian Truman.

title: Mary Jane Truman sitting on a swing on the Grandview farm
Scopenote: One of a series of photos from Mary Jane Truman's Christmas Album, 1906.  Mary Jane Truman (right) sitting in a swing on the Grandview farm, with an unidentified lady stand on left.  There is a dog with them.  Caption says "The Shoogy-Shoo."   From:  Copied from photos lent to the Truman Library by Martha Ann Swoyer, daughter of Vivian Truman.

title: Mary Jane Truman sitting on a stile
Scopenote: One of a series of photos from Mary Jane Truman's Christmas Album, 1906. Mary Jane Truman  sitting on a stile over a fence on the Truman farm in Grandview, Missouri.  Caption says "Back to the Old Stile."   From:  Copied from photos lent to the Truman Library by Martha Ann Swoyer, daughter of Vivian Truman.

title: Mary Jane Truman and an unidentified woman
Scopenote: One of a series of photos from Mary Jane Truman's Christmas Album, 1906.  Mary Jane Truman (left foreground) and unidentified woman watching two men canoeing in the distance.  Same woman as in 84-12-17. They are probably near the Grandview farm.  From:  Photographs lent to the Truman Library by Martha Ann Swoyer, daughter of Vivian Truman.

title: Mary Jane Truman and visitors at Grandview farm
Scopenote: One of a series of photos from Mary Jane Truman's Christmas Album, 1906.  Mary Jane Truman (left) seated on a fence on the Grandview farm in a dark skirt, with four unidentified young women.  Caption says "The Visitors Are On the Fence."  From:  Copied from photos lent to the Truman Library by Martha Ann Swoyer, daughter of Vivian Truman.

title: Men and women on a hay-filled wagon at Grandview farm
Scopenote: One of a series of photos from Mary Jane Truman's Christmas Album, 1906. Blurred picture of a group of men and women on a hay-filled wagon at the Grandview farm.  Caption says "A Real Hayride."   From: Copied from photos lent to the Truman Library by Martha Ann Swoyer, daughter of Vivian Truman.

title: Mary Jane Truman leaning against a tree
Scopenote: One of a series of photos from Mary Jane Truman's Christmas Album, 1906.  Mary Jane Truman posing, leaning against a tree, near the Grandview farm.    From:  Copied from photos lent to the Truman Library by Martha Ann Swoyer, a daughter of Vivian Truman.

title: Mary Jane Truman standing on a bridge
Scopenote: One of a series of photos from Mary Jane Truman's Christmas Album, 1906.  Mary Jane Truman standing on a bridge, leaning over the railing, looking at the water.  Caption says "Reflections." She is probably near the Grandview farm.  From:  Copied from photos lent to the Truman Library by Martha Ann Swoyer, daughter of Vivian Truman.

title: An old schoolhouse near Grandview farm
Scopenote: Photo of what appears to be an old schoolhouse near the Grandview farm.  Caption says "Dear Old Rock Ford."  One of a series of photos from Mary Jane Truman's Christmas Album, 1906.   From:  Copied from photos lent to the Truman Library by Martha Ann Swoyer, a daughter of Vivian Truman.

title: Portrait of two young boys
Scopenote: One of a series of photos from Mary Jane Truman's Christmas Album, 1906.  Portrait of two young boys, about the ages of four and five, both unidentified.    From:  Copied from photos lent to the Truman Library by Martha Ann Swoyer, a daughter of Vivian Truman.

title: View of the Grandview farmhouse
Scopenote: One of a series of photos from Mary Jane Truman's Christmas Album, 1906.  Distance view of the Grandview farmhouse, showing the grove of Maple trees and the barn.  Caption says "The Big Maple Grove."  From:  Copied from photos lent to the Truman Library by Martha Ann Swoyer, daughter of Vivian Truman.

title: Mary Jane Truman at Grandview Farm
Scopenote: One of a series of photos from Mary Jane Truman's Christmas Album, 1906.  Mary Jane Truman (left) seated on a fence on the Grandview farm, with four unidentified girls below her.  Caption says "The Visitors Are on the Fence."  From:  Copied from photos lent to the Truman Library by Martha Ann Swoyer, daughter of Vivian Truman.

title: Two women gathering flowers at Grandview farm
Scopenote: One of a series of photos from Mary Jane Truman's Christmas Album, 1906. Two unidentified women gathering flowers in a field at the Grandview farm. Caption says "Gathering Goldenrod." From: Copied from photos lent to the Truman Library by Martha Ann Swoyer, daughter of Vivian Truman.

title: Unidentified couple by a brick building
Scopenote: One of a series of photos from Mary Jane Truman's Christmas Album, 1906. Unidentified couple posed by a brick building. From: Copied from photos lent to the Truman Library by Martha Ann Swoyer, a daughter of Vivian Truman.

title: A young Vivian Truman by a haystack
Scopenote: Good photo of Vivian Truman posing by a haystack.  Caption says "A good prop." One of a series of photos from Mary Jane Truman's Christmas Album, 1906.    From:  Copied from photos lent to the Harry S. Truman Library by Martha Ann Swoyer, daughter of Vivian Truman.

title: Closer view of two men rowing in a canoe
Scopenote: One of a series of photos from Mary Jane Truman's Christmas Album, 1906.  Closer (very blurred) view of the two unidentified men rowing in a canoe. They are probably near the Grandview farm.  From:  Copied from photos lent to the Truman Library by Martha Ann Swoyer, daughter of Vivian Truman.

title: Photo of young woman and three young boys at Grandview farm
Scopenote: One of a series of photos from Mary Jane Truman's Christmas Album, 1906.  Photo of a young woman and three young boys posing at the Grandview farm.  The barn is in the background.  All of the people are unidentified; it is unknown if they are related to the Truman family.    From:  Copied from photos lent to the Truman Library by Martha Ann Swoyer, a daughter of Vivian Truman.

title: Mary Jane Truman, Mary Ethel Noland, and Robert Truman Ragland standing by the pump in back of the Grandview farmhouse
Scopenote: Standing by the pump in back of the Grandview farmhouse, Left to Right:  Mary Jane Truman, possibly Mary Ethel Noland, and possibly Robert Truman Ragland, "Trumie" who was the brother of Ardis Haukenberry and the son of Ruth Noland.    From:  Copied from photos lent to the Truman Library by Martha Ann Swoyer, a daughter of Vivian Truman.

title: Portrait of Mary Jane Truman as a young woman
Scopenote: Very nice portrait of Mary Jane Truman as a young woman.  She is wearing a large bow in the back of her hair, and looks to be about 18 years of age.   From:  Copied from photos lent to the Truman Library by Martha Ann Swoyer, daughter of Vivian Truman.

title: Harry S. Truman and His Mother and Grandmother on the Grandview Farm
Scopenote: Early photo of the Grandview farmhouse of the Truman family.  In front of the house, left to right: Martha Ellen Truman, Harry Truman's mother; Harriet Louisa Gregg Young, Truman's grandmother; and a young Harry S. Truman in farm clothes.  Same as 83-126, but better image.    From:  Copy of original photo lent to the Truman Library by Martha Ann Swoyer, daughter of Vivian Truman.

title: Portrait of a young Harry S. Truman in derby hat
Scopenote: Excellent portrait of Harry S. Truman wearing a derby hat, with a Masonic pin in his lapel.  From:  Copied from photos lent to the Truman Library by Martha Ann Swoyer, a daughter of Vivian Truman.

title: Group of unidentified men in front of railroad train car
Scopenote: Group of unidentified men in front of a railroad train car.  Possibly taken during a trip made by Harry S. Truman to South Dakota in October, 1911 to register for a claim for homesteads.  From:  Copied from photos lent to the Truman Library by Martha Ann Swoyer, daughter of Vivian Truman.

title: Bess Wallace and others standing on a road
Scopenote: Standing on a road, dressed in winter clothing, Left to Right:  Bess Wallace (holding a muff), George Wallace, and an unidentified young woman.  From:  Copied from a photo album lent to the Truman Library by May Wallace.

title: Bess Wallace on a picnic
Scopenote: Bess Wallace (second from the left) with a group of unidentified girlfriends on a picnic.  They are standing outside, wearing winter clothes.  From:  Copied from a photo album lent to the Truman Library by May Wallace.

title: Bess Wallace and Others Sitting on a Farm Fence
Scopenote: Sitting on a farm fence, with a planted field in the background, left to right:  Bess Wallace, Mrs. Emma P. Southern (mother of May Wallace), and May Wallace.  From:  Copied from a photo album lent to the Truman Library by May Wallace.

title: Bess Wallace and a group of her friends
Scopenote: Bess Wallace and group of her friends standing on a road in the winter time.  They are on their way to a picnic at Wayne City Landing on the Missouri River.  Left to Right:  Helena Crow, probably George Millard, May Wallace, Caroline Southern, Alden Millard and Bess Wallace. For similar photos, see  82-58-17 through 82-58-35.  From:  Copied from photos lent to the Truman Library by Martha Ann Swoyer, daughter of Vivian Truman.

title: Close-up of Bess Wallace's face
Scopenote: Close-up of Bess Wallace's face from a snapshot taken at a picnic.  rom:  Copied from a photo album lent to the Truman Library by May Wallace.

title: Bess Wallace and Harry S. Truman on a Fishing Trip
Scopenote: Photo taken of Bess Wallace Truman and Harry S. Truman during their courting days.  They are seated among friends in a rowboat on the Little Blue River.  L to R: Mrs. Emma P. Southern, mother of May Wallace, Bess Wallace (holding a fishing pole), Harry S. Truman, an unidentified man, and a young woman, probably Natalie Wallace. Others in the boat are unidentified. A letter to Bess from Harry, dated August 5, 1913, mentions preparing to go with her on a fishing trip on the Little Blue River.  Copied from a photo album lent to the Truman Library by May Wallace.

title: Harry Truman, Bess Wallace, and Others in a Car
Scopenote: From left to right: Bess Wallace, Harry S. Truman, Nellie Noland, and Mary Jane Truman are riding in Harry S. Truman's Stafford car, probably around the Grandview farm area.  Mary Jane appears to be holding a fishing pole.    Copied from photos lent to the Truman Library by Martha Ann Swoyer, daughter of J. Vivian Truman.

title: Bess Wallace and others standing in the woods
Scopenote: Standing in the woods, Left to Right:  George Wallace, Bess Wallace, Fred Wallace, Harry Truman, tapping Fred on the shoulder (Truman's head is cut off in the photo); in the foreground, probably Natalie Wallace and possibly Frank Wallace on the right.  From:  Copied from a photo album lent to the Truman Library by May Wallace.

title: Parade of cars near Grandview farm
Scopenote: Photo found among the photographs copied from Martha Ann Swoyer's collection of an unidentified parade of cars (three cars, all full of people) parked along a country road.  Presumably this is around the Grandview farm.  From:  Copied from photos lent to the Truman Library by Martha Ann Swoyer, a daughter of Vivian Truman.

title: Portrait of Mary Jane Truman
Scopenote: Very nice portrait of Mary Jane Truman at about age 32.  She is wearing a large-brimmed hat.  From:  Copied from photos lent to the Truman Library by Martha Ann Swoyer, daughter of Vivian Truman.

title: Portrait of Mary Jane Truman
Scopenote: Very nice portrait of Mary Jane Truman at about age 32.    From:  Copied from photos lent to the Truman Library by Martha Ann Swoyer, daughter of Vivian Truman.

title: Portrait of Martha Ellen Truman
Scopenote: Portrait of Martha Ellen Truman as a middle aged lady.  Same as 62-462 and 60-254, only better copy.  From:  Copied from photos lent to the Truman Library by Martha Ann Swoyer, daughter of Vivian Truman.

title: Portrait of Mary Jane Truman and a couple
Scopenote: Portrait of Mary Jane Truman (left) and an unidentified couple.  From:  Copied from photos lent to the Truman Library by Martha Ann Swoyer, daughter of Vivian Truman.

title: Martha Ellen Truman and Mary Jane Truman in a porch swing at Grandview farmhouse
Scopenote: Martha Ellen Truman and Mary Jane Truman (mother and sister of Harry S. Truman) sitting in the swing on the porch of the Truman farmhouse in Grandview, Missouri.   From:  Copied from photos lent to the Truman Library by Martha Ann Swoyer, a daughter of Vivian Truman.

title: Martha Ellen Truman watches a herd of sheep grazing in front of the Truman farmhouse
Scopenote: A herd of sheep grazing in front of the Truman farmhouse while Martha Ellen Truman, mother of Harry s. Truman, watches from the porch.  The arbor is visible to the side.   From:  Copied from photos lent to the Truman Library by Martha Ann Swoyer, a daughter of Vivian Truman.

title: Portrait of Martha Ellen Truman
Scopenote: Very nice portrait of Martha Ellen Truman, mother of Harry S. Truman, that is similar to the one on which the Jerry Farnsworth painting of Mrs. Truman is based. (See also photo 2009-1516). From: Copied from photos lent to the Truman Library by Martha Ann Swoyer, daughter of Vivian Truman.

title: Photo of Martha Ellen Truman and Mary Jane Truman
Scopenote: Photo of Martha Ellen Truman (seated), and Mary Jane Truman (standing next to her) posing outdoors.   From:  Copied from photos lent to the Truman Library by Martha Ann Swoyer, a daughter of Vivian Truman.

title: President Truman on White House grounds smelling flowers
Scopenote: Full-length photograph of President Truman smelling the blossoms on a tree on the White House lawn.  Similar to 59-1559.  From:  Copied from photos lent to the Truman Library by Martha Ann Swoyer, daughter of Vivian Truman.

title: Official White House portrait of President Truman
Scopenote: Official White House portrait of President Truman by Greta Kempton. From: White House.

title: President Truman Receives Degree from Baylor University
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman on the podium stand, receiving an honorary degree from Baylor University.  Gov. Pat Neff and Gov. Beauford Jester are to the right of Truman.

title: Harry Truman and his sister, Mary Jane Truman
Scopenote: Harry Truman and his sister, Mary Jane Truman, apparently attending a 35th Division reunion.  Harry Truman has a Battery D band on his arm.  From:  Copied from photos lent to the Truman Library by Martha Ann Swoyer, daughter of Vivian Truman.

title: Truman house in Independence
Scopenote: One of a series of photos from original 35mm slides of the Truman home, 219 N. Delaware, probably taken by Margaret Truman sometime in the 1950s, before 1954. This image is of the rear of the house showing steps leading down from the back porch and the arbor in the backyard.   Original is slide 2119, from which an internegative has been made.  From: Truman House

title: Truman house in Independence, front view in winter
Scopenote: Front exterior of the Truman house in winter.  From original slide 2117.   From: Truman house. One of a series of photos from original slides of the Truman home, 219 N. Delaware, possibly taken by Margaret Truman sometime in the 1950s, before 1954.

title: Truman house in Independence, back porch view
Scopenote: Rear of the Truman house in Independence, Missouri, showing the back porch area.  From original slide 2118.  From:  Truman house. One of a series of photos from original 35 mm slides of the Truman home, 219 N. Delaware, possibly taken by Margaret Truman sometime in the 1950s, before 1954.

title: Truman house in Independence, back porch view
Scopenote: Rear of the house showing the back porch and sleeping porch area. From original slide 2305. From: Truman house. One of a series of photos from original 35mm slides of the Truman home, 219 N. Delaware, possibly taken by Margaret Truman sometime in the 1950's, before 1954.

title: President Truman walking through a chow line at Aberdeen Proving Ground
Scopenote: Walking through a chow line in the enlisted men's mess, President Truman takes bountiful helpings of steak, fried potatoes, salad and chocolate pie during his visit to the Aberdeen Proving Ground to see some of the latest developments in ground weapons and vehicles, many still top secret.  From:  Copied from photos lent to the Truman Library by Martha Ann Swoyer, a daughter of Vivian Truman.

title: President and Mrs. Truman with French President Auriol
Scopenote: Reception at the French Embassy during the visit of President Vincent Auriol of France to the United States.  In reception line, Left to Right:  Unidentified lady, Ambassador Henri Bonnet of France, President Vincent Auriol, unidentified man, President Harry S. Truman, and First Lady Bess Truman.  The Harry S. Truman Library museum collection has the dress which Mrs. Truman is wearing.  From:  Copied from photos lent to the Truman Library by Martha Ann Swoyer, daughter of Vivian Truman.

title: President Truman seated by globe in an office
Scopenote: Close-up photo of President Truman seated by globe in an office by a window. Probably taken in his office at the Federal Reserve Bank Building. From original 35mm slide number 2328. From: Transferred from manuscript collection by archivist Erwin Mueller, origin unknown.

title: Truman and Benton in front of the mural at the Truman Library
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (left) and Thomas Hart Benton standing in the doorway in the center of Benton's mural, "Independence and the Opening of the West" in the lobby of the Harry S. Truman Library.

title: Harry Truman and Family Members in his Office at Truman Library
Scopenote: Harry Truman and family members stand in his office at the Truman Library. Left to right: Unidentified man, Henrietta Truman (sister of Corbie Truman), unidentified woman, Vivian Truman, Luella Truman (Vivian's wife), Corbie Truman and his wife, Bess Truman, Harry Truman, Olive Truman, Mary Jane Truman, and Margaret and Louis Truman. Autograph (not original) says "To Mary Jane from Harry, best of everything, Harry S. Truman, 7/23/62" From: Copied from photos lent to the Truman Library by Martha Ann Swoyer, daughter of Vivian Truman.

title: Funeral of Sam Rayburn, with Truman, Eisenhower, and Kennedy
Scopenote: Harry S. Truman, Dwight D. Eisenhower, and John F. Kennedy at the funeral of Sam Rayburn in Bonham, Texas.  The photo is autographed by each person.  (The autographs are not original, but photographic copy).  From Margaret Truman Daniel, 10-83.

title: Exterior view of the Truman Library Liberty Bell
Scopenote: Exterior view of the Liberty Bell and the Harry S. Truman Library, a fall setting.  A bicentennial flag is flying as well as an American flag.

title: Bronze Eagle
Scopenote: Postcard of a bronze eagle ("The Hunter") in the atrium of the east entrance of the Harry S. Truman Library.  The eagle was sculpted by Greg Steiner.

title: Truman Home
Scopenote: Postcard of an autumn exterior of the Truman home at 219 N Delaware, Independence, Missouri.

title: Photo of Oil Painting of Harry S. Truman
Scopenote: Photo of oil painting of Harry S. Truman by John English.  The painting was used in the Truman Centennial Exhibit prepared by the Mid America Arts Alliance.  The painting shows Truman grinning, waving his hat.  From: John English.

title: Portraits of Harry and Vivian Truman from Grandview Farmhouse
Scopenote: One of a series of Polaroid snapshots of various pieces of furniture and belongings which were at one time in the Grandview farmhouse.  These snapshots were taken by Martha Ann Swoyer (Harry S. Truman's niece), who gave them to the Library. This picture shows photographic portraits of Harry and Vivian Truman which hung in the Sitting Room.

title: Table used in old dining room at Grandview farmhouse
Scopenote: One of a series of Polaroid snapshots of various pieces of furniture and belongings which were at one time in the Grandview farmhouse.  These snapshots were taken by Martha Ann Swoyer (Harry S. Truman's niece), who gave them to the Harry S. Truman Library. This photo is of a table used in the old dining room.

title: Chairs used with the dining room table in Grandview farmhouse
Scopenote: One of a series of Polaroid snapshots of various pieces of furniture and belongings which were at one time in the Grandview farmhouse.  These snapshots were taken by Martha Ann Swoyer (Harry s. Truman's niece), who gave them to the Harry S. Truman Library. Photo is of chairs used with the dining room table.

title: Dresser that was in Martha Ellen Truman's bedroom at Grandview farmhouse
Scopenote: One of a series of Polaroid snapshots of various pieces of furniture and belongings which were at one time in the Grandview farmhouse.  These snapshots were taken by Martha Ann Swoyer (Harry S. Truman's niece), who gave them to the Harry S. Truman Library. This photo is of a mirrored dresser in Martha Ellen Truman's bedroom.

title: Painting that hung in a Grandview farmhouse, of a hunting dog
Scopenote: Painting of a hunting dog which hung on the south wall of the dining room. One of a series of Polaroid snapshots of various pieces of furniture and belongings which were at one time in the Grandview farmhouse.  These snapshots were taken by Martha Ann Swoyer (Harry S. Truman's niece), who gave the photos to the Harry S. Truman Library.

title: Legs of the Dining Room Table that was in Grandview Farmhouse
Scopenote: One of a series of Polaroid snapshots of various pieces of furniture and belongings which were at one time in the Grandview farmhouse.  These snapshots were taken by Martha Ann Swoyer (Harry S. Truman's niece), who gave them to the Harry S. Truman Library. This image shows the legs of the dining room table.

title: Dresser from Martha Ellen Truman's bedroom
Scopenote: One of a series of Polaroid snapshots of various pieces of furniture and belongings which were at one time in the Grandview farmhouse.  These snapshots were taken by Martha Ann Swoyer (Harry S. Truman's niece), who gave them to the Harry S. Truman Library. This photo is of a dresser from Martha Ellen Truman's bedroom.

title: Margaret Truman Daniel receives the Harry S. Truman Public Service Award
Scopenote: Margaret Truman Daniel receives the Harry S. Truman Public Service Award from the city of Independence, Missouri, at the Harry S. Truman Library. Margaret Truman Daniel's husband, Clifton Daniel, is seated at left. Mayor Barbara Potts of Independence is standing (dark suit) next to Mrs. Daniel. Former Senator Thomas Eagleton (clapping) and Rep. Ike Skelton are at far right. This photograph is from Library contact sheet 84-35.
